item.title: Rusted metal box and gas canister left on the pave., 13th June
item.description:

item.title: Branches need thinning, 13th June
item.description:
Branches from trees are encroaching onto building and obscuring commercial tenants units on ground floor. There are also some low hanging branches with risk of pedestrians causing themselves injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 434, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation blocking Lansdown Road, Sidcup, 13th June
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation blocking Lansdown Road, Sidcup, at entrance to Waring Park. The Council is responsible for the tree. Particularly when it rains, the tree sags down and anyone over 5 foot tall has to duck as the tree drops even lower. It needs cutting back a lot more frequently because it just regrows every 6 months and causes the same problems. Once it was left for too long and people walked in the road to avoid it which is dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wastebags are dumped in the street, 13th June
item.description:
20 or more waste bags are dumped in the street which are in close vicinity to the bus stop, emitting rotten food smell. It's quite unbearable, please resolve it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutland Gate, Knightsbridge, London

item.title: Can this tree be pollarded as it ruins the Outlook., 13th June

item.title: Man hole cover rocking and very loud., 13th June
item.description:
The man hole cover is rocking a d making a very loud noise everytime a vehicle or bus goes over it. I reported it 6 months ago nothing has been done and now it's seriously loud stopping us from sleeping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Parkside, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Council vehicles illegaly parked blocking cycle way, 13th June
item.description:
Hackney Homes vans park along Reading Lane, they often park up against the safety barrier, but it's usually only on one side or they park back a bit. Today, 2 vans were parked right up against the gaps on double yellow lines.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reading Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light shining in our bedroom, 13th June
item.description:

item.title: Considerable broken glass in road/on pavement, 13th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Genoa Road, Anerley, London
